name: "Road to Rupert" Quiz / Test | 'Family Guy'- Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these things does Peter sell at the family garage sale?
questions.explanation:
His anvil.

	In the beginning of this episode, the family is participating in a garage sale, getting rid of the items that they no longer need.  Peter reminisces about the anvil he once attempted to use to trick unsuspecting people in the park, and then offers to buy a set of his own 'Evil Knievel' gloves for $35.  Chris, meanwhile, is able to sell a bunch of his clothes to Herbert, which many know as the neighbourhood's creepy old man.

questions.text: For how much money does Brian accidentally sell Rupert?
options: He sells it for free with a toaster oven
questions.explanation:
$1.

	After Brian accidentally sells Stewie's teddy bear, Rupert, without knowing it, Stewie is afraid that he has lost his bear and considers the grim funeral that could be in the future (though it bears a striking similarity to Spock's death in "Wrath of Khan").After Peter buys his own Evil Knievel gloves from himself, he attempts to jump a row of cars on Spooner Street.  This leads him to not only crash his own car, but he ends up crashing on top of a bunch of cars as well, injuring many.  Joe later takes Peter's license because of his reckless driving, the way he disturbed the peace, and because a piece of shrapnel pierced a certain bystander, rape was added to his list of offenses.  Lois likes this idea.

questions.text: What is the name of the sitcom that Peter creates in his head?
questions.explanation:
My Black Son.

	After Joe takes Peter's license, he spends time watching episodes of "Cheers", which he feels went downhill after Kirstie Alley's character ate Shelly Long.  To make things interesting, Peter pretends to be part of the show and he decides to punch out the TV when he gets angry with how the characters are treating him.  Peter decides to create his own sitcom, "My Black Son", to spend his time.  In this show, Peter's black son is also a ninja.

questions.text: Which character do Brian and Stewie hitch a ride with to follow the man who bought Rupert?
questions.explanation:
Adam West.

	When Lois finds Peter hiding in the fridge, she announces that she's found him a chauffeur- Meg.Meanwhile, using DNA forensics and top-notch technology (from the government), Stewie and Brian determine that a man named Stanford Cordray bought Rupert at the garage sale and that he lives a few blocks away.  They later realize that Stanford just recently decided to move and they just miss his moving van leaving the street.  They hop into Adam West's car and head off in hot pursuit.  Adam West asks them to play Twenty Questions, but he soon reveals that his answer is Bo Bice.

questions.text: Which TV show does Meg play to keep Peter occupied in the car?
questions.explanation:
Spongebob Squarepants.

	As soon as Brian and Stewie arrive at the Connecticut border, Adam West drops them off claiming that if he enters the state, then it's like being with every state that that state has ever been with.  Luckily, the moving van accidentally loses a box at the border and they find that they need to go to Aspen, Colorado.Meanwhile, Peter is angry with the idea of having Meg drive him around and makes a big fuss until she plays a DVD of "Spongebob Squarepants" in the car.

questions.text: What do the guys do to Meg while she drives them home (later causing her to attack another driver)?
options: They spray her with a fire hose
They roll down all the windows in the car
They crash her into a billboard
questions.explanation:
They set her on fire.

	While driving the guys home after a night at the bar, they decide to set Meg's hat on fire while she's driving and they douse her with beer to put out the flames.  When another driver gets angry at her, she gets out of the car and beats him while the other guys watch from the car, cheering her on.Meanwhile, Brian and Stewie head through Gettysburg and cross the United States to get Rupert back.

questions.text: How do Stewie and Brian cross the Rocky Mountains?
questions.explanation:
In a helicopter.

	When Brian and Stewie arrive at the Rocky Mountains, they find that they can pilot a helicopter across it to reach Aspen.  To get the keys to one of these, Stewie breaks into a song and dance in a live-action scene with Gene Kelly.  They later crash the copter.Meanwhile, Peter, impressed with the way Meg fought the other driver, calls her as cool as the other side of his pillow.

questions.text: What is the name of the young boy who comes into possession of Rupert?
questions.explanation:
Timmy.

	When Brian and Stewie arrive in Aspen, they find Stanford's house and they see that his son, Timmy, now owns Rupert.  In order to get Rupert back, Stewie challenges Stanford, a champion skier, to a race down one of the Rocky Mountains.  Otherwise, Stanford can take full ownership of Brian.Meanwhile Meg takes Peter to the drive-in, and she even performs the same stunt that Peter failed (leading him to lose his license.  Peter describes their time as more fun than seeing "Lost in Translation".

questions.text: Stewie defeats Stanford in the race for Rupert.
questions.explanation:
False.

	During the ski race, Stewie uses rockets in his skis as well as a collapsible metal compartment to cruise down the mountain at high speeds, but during this time, he crashes into a tree and loses the race to Stanford, who simply completes the task.Meanwhile, Peter's suspension ends and Meg fears that Peter will go back to his normal self.  When Lois comes out with fresh glasses of lemonade, Peter comments that he wants a 'fresh glass of better daughter', though he indicates that he now has more respect for Meg.  He just insults her to keep up appearances.

questions.text: How do Stewie and Brian return to Quahog?
options: They don't- the episode ends with them still in Colorado
questions.explanation:
They steal a car.

	After the race, Stewie has his servant (seen in his metal skiing compartment) splash hot tea into Timmy's eyes and they steal Rupert back.  Brian simply doesn't go to permanently live with the Cordray family, and they leave.  They use the starting gun from the ski race to hijack a car at an intersection and they return to Quahog having held a man at gunpoint and committing grand theft auto.
